availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin Franklin Crofoot (Louisville, Kentucky, drayman and deputy marshal)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, drayman and deputy marshal. New York native. Son of Roswell Crofoot and Nancy Crofoot. Married to Laura Ann Thompson Crofoot in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on February 2, 1854. Father of Anna Crofoot, Emma Crofoot, and Lou Crofoot. Farmer in Lawrence County, Indiana, in 1850. Dray overseer in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1858. Drayman in Louisville in 1860. Deputy marshal in Louisville in 1861. Drayman in Louisville in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Lawrence County, Marion, p. 341A.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482708.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994041, Jefferson County Deaths.
